intro: Carludovica dentata, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features palmate leaves with serrated edges, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Carludovica dentata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
